did.unittitle: First Baptist Church (Ann Arbor, Mich.) records 1837-1991
did.abstract: Ann Arbor, Michigan Baptist church established in 1828; church covenant, committee reports, annual reports, correspondence, financial records, membership rolls, treasurer's books, and scrapbooks; and records of church auxiliary organizations, including the Women's Society, the Baptist Students' Guild, and the Sunshine Circle of the International Order of King's Daughters and Sons.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was deposited by the church (Donor no. 927) in several accessions. The records of the Sunshine Circle were donated by Mrs. Sarah E. Stampfler (donor no. 4733)

accruals.p: Additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, First Baptist Church (Ann Arbor, Mich.) records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The First Baptist Church of Ann Arbor, Michigan was organized May 10, 1828.

scopecontent.p: The records of the First Baptist Church of Ann Arbor document the life and activities of the church from its beginnings in 1828 to the early 1990s. The record group has been arranged into the following series: Covenant meetings; History / Background; Annual reports of church committees; Church archives: bulletins, annual reports, newsletters, and related materials; Church groups; Membership and other governance records; Financial records; Topical files; and Audio-Visual Materials.

odd.p: The Sunshine Circle, though closely associated with the First Baptist Church, is not a formal church organization
